intro: Nassauvia patula, commonly known as the silverleaf nassauvia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial shrub characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open woodlands. Its leaves are covered in fine, white hairs that help reduce water loss and reflect sunlight. Nassauvia patula is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance.
